title: The Visigoths have gone somewhat out of style these days except perhaps in England
The Goths in Spain
is by far the best present treatment. Also, see the same author, Elfin del reino visgodo de Toledo

is the best of careful scholarship if, perhaps, too ready to believe that law gets regularly applied

lives up to the title
treat that most necessary institution for the Roman and Visigothic periods in a ponderous and quite traditional fashion but the basic information is provided

title: The Cambridge History of Islam
supplies, amidst much else, a brief history of Islam in western North Africa
is the best short survey in English
A History of Islamic Spain, Edinburgh, 1965, is handy and unfailingly intelligible for the newcomer. Roger Collins, The Arab Conquest of Spain
is the most recent and authoritative treatment of that subject. The same author, Early Medieval Spain
handily puts the former in a somewhat larger context
Agricultural Innovation in the Early Islamic World
calls careful attention to a subject ordinarily treated with platitudes. Juan Vernet, La cultura hispanodrabe en Orient y Occidente
supplies many specifics and complements Chejne. A yet wider context for events is supplied by Archibald R
The Jews of Muslim Spain
